item.title: Euclidean Division Theorem
item.description: Theorem Given two integers $a$ and $b$, with $b \neq 0$, there exists unique integers $q$ and $r$ such that: $$a = bq + r \text{ and } 0 \leq r \lt |b|$$

item.title: Prime Number Theorem (PNT)
item.description: Prime Number Theorem gives an approximate value for the number of [[notes/math/discrete-math/number-theory/Prime numbers|primes]] less than or equal to any given positive real number $x$.
